Reviews.Title: “Affordable and nice! The indoor pool is so nice and warm.”
Reviews.Author: frizzell
Reviews.Content: We arrive at the Ozark mountain inn no expecting much. During arrival we we greeted by a nice staff member. We found the rate to be very competitive and felt we would get what we paid for. The rooms were clean. The indoor pool was very clean and warm! The hot tub was a hot, but they did have jacuzzi rooms available if you wanted jets. The breakfast was a typical continental. We would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Tired & smoky”
Reviews.Author: glopaul
Reviews.Content: Rooms and surrounds always smelled smoky, even though we were in a non-smoking room. Very noisy at night as children were in pool till 10.45pm. Very tired and rundown premises. Breakfast was OK for continental. Staff appearance and hygiene needs improving. Good location. Would not recommend as other places in same price range were better.

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLE! DO NOT LET YOUR FAMILY STAY HERE!”
Reviews.Author: bransonart
Reviews.Content: This is bad. I'm local, and also own a business, If we encounter any problems with our customers, we will always do whatever it takes to satisfy. My sister came in with four other people (2 rooms) for my daughter's wedding. I didn't know she booked at this hotel. When they arrived the outside pool was green and was down for three days. They told her they were working with it. The inside pool was very clouded, and the answer for this was when alot of people are in the pool it always clouds. Their room was dirty. Food under the bed and dust around baseboards. Bathroom not clean and very old sheets and pillows. In one of the rooms the air conditioner did not work. (August) When they went to the office to complain, it was locked. The desk person was on the balcony smoking. When we did get a call later from the manager, after I personally went to the hotel, he talked to my sister and was rude and said she was putting down his property, but did offer a free night. As if!!! Who would go back. She asked for her money back and he told her there was no system in place where he could do that, but he would think about it and call her the next day. Needless to say that's been weeks ago and no call. Please stay away from this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “be warned”
Reviews.Author: cheryl b
Reviews.Content: First mistake....I paid cash. second mistake, I didn't book another hotel room. The carpet was dirty...food from last guest under edge of bed platform,which led me to wonder..what else wasn't clean. Staff outside smokeing with office locked when I tried to complain. Family owned and operated????? Glad I'm not part of that family. No pride. I will tell everyone who will listen..DO NOT STAY HERE. EVERYONE I SPOKE WITH WAS RUDE! Lesson learned

Reviews.Title: “Mold on the walls, Trashy, Unfriendly Staff.”
Reviews.Author: jjkjazz
Reviews.Content: If you care about your health, do NOT stay here. You will wake up with God knows what just from breathing the air. Very unclean, even for a MOTEL. Rude staff. Do yourself a favor and spend the extra money to go to an actual name/chain Hotel that is at least clean. This place is awful. I'm pretty sure they bought their beds from a summer camp.

Reviews.Title: “nice indoor pool”
Reviews.Author: biggsy3
Reviews.Content: very affordable hotel. the furnishngs were a little dated, but everything was pretty clean. the service was excellent. we asked for extra towels and pillows and they were there in minutes. the outdoor pool was closed, but we loved the indoor pool and hot tub. it had great character. we had a room overlooking the indoor pool and the doors near the pool could be kept open so it had kind of an indoor/outdoor feel.

Reviews.Title: “Shoestring budget operation.”
Reviews.Author: timurray2000
Reviews.Content: Went real well until the last day. Our room didn't get cleaned. They also took the towels then didn't replace them and said they only had 2 towels left (even though they took 4 from the room). The lady that was so nice at checkin wasn't so nice about the towels. She actually wanted to know WHY we needed 4!!

Reviews.Title: “TERRIBLE, AWFUL, WORST PLACE EVER!”
Reviews.Author: TinkPink11
Reviews.Content: If you miss the 1970's, please visit here! The owners obviously are only putting money in their pockets based on the location. That is the only thing this place has going for it! It needs to be updated BADLY!!! The railings could be a death trap direct down to the indoor pool. Oh, and want to stay by the pool, that will cost you extra! Breakfast? Just walk OUTSIDE to something worse than old mini donuts, cereal that I'm sure was stale and OJ, no, that's not OJ it's "orange flavored" water! If you want cheap, you can stay here, but it's only worth about $29.. The only thing missing was the bugs....thank goodness for that. PS-I hope you don't go here for the Christmas season, because the parking lot is straight downhill!

Reviews.Title: “Underhanded business practicing”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer033
Reviews.Content: We booked 2 rooms, for 2 nights,2 weeks in advance,as was given the price of 32.47 per night +tx with the 3rd night being free.So stay 2 get 1 .This price was quoted by Hotels.com,Orbitz & Expedia.So when I called the Hotel to book the clerk looked with me online & we booked thru Expedia.I was given a conformation # & thankyou.When we arrived for check in our room was ready for $144.00+ When I tried to explain this was not the price given the fast talking,loud young man came up with a whole scenario of nonsense of how we were misinformed by the clerk who booked us.We interjected that it wasnt only the clerk, we booked by the discount on line.So were sure this Hotel still got theyre kickback from Expedia & us.The tubs were dirty,the carpet had not been vacuumed.Our 2nd day there they didnt vacuum.,& just threw the spread over the bed un madeIn the 2nd room to get them to vacuum I sprinkled more cracker crumbs,with the ones allready there.There is water damage that Im sure has been there since it was a Travele lodge.With all of the other Motels ,Hotels in Branson competing for business dont waste your money here.IT'S NOT the TRAVEL LODGE of OLD.Oh & we cancelled our reservations with Deer Run for this dump,which would have been $ 114.00 +tx for 2 nights 3 free.Fool me once!

Reviews.Title: “Jimmy”
Reviews.Author: toinfinity050
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at the Hotel--Kids loved both pools. The Hotel was ok--but the service from Jimmy was amazing!!! He ran the breakfast and the first day my son asked for donuts w/ sprinkles and he went to the back to get it for him. The NEXT 3 days, he had them waiting for him as we walked thru the doors!!! He told my son he was saving it for him and made my son feel VERY SPECIAL!!! Thanks Jimmy!!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, quiet, nice pool, bring your own pillow though”
Reviews.Author: Sanders4
Reviews.Content: This hotel, like the other reviews say, is on a hill. The first thing I learned was you can't set your luggage down beside the car. It's definitely not a parking lot for folks who have difficulty walking. The staff was cordial, but not overly friendly. We had no problems checking in. It is an older hotel, but clean. After the first night, we learned to keep the a/c on 7 or below or it will freeze, and the room gets very hot, expecially the last day of spring. The fan could have used a boost. We bought a fan from the local WalMart, which is about 10 minutes from the hotel, to help it push the air to the other side of the room. We should have bought pillows as well. They were flat and small. We stayed on the 3rd floor, east side. It was quiet at night. We had internet in the room, but not at the outdoor pool or the north end of the hotel. The indoor pool is heated. The outdoor pool is clean and big enough. We got a couple of "beach towels", which were no bigger than the regular towels in the room, for a refundable $2.50 each. But, we didn't get our refund back because the cleaning folks picked them up. They also picked up our shampoo, not sure why. It was obviously not the hotels nor empty. We had a nice time in Branson and will be back, but next time we'll stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Amber M
Reviews.Content: Very nice, friendly staff. Husband and I loved the hot tub and pool. The rooms were clean and spacious. The driveway is a steep one, so if you have a vehicle with a standard transmission be careful. Besides that, the place is great!

Reviews.Title: “Great for the price!”
Reviews.Author: Jr_Mint
Reviews.Content: I was a bit intimidated by some of the reviews I had read online about this hotel, but once there, I realized that the economy has taken its toll on many and has driven them to come down a couple notches in their spending habits. If you're paying 50 to 70 dollars for a room, you're not going to get Hilton-style service and/or amenities. However, the friendliness of the staff was definitely 5-star. Yes, the hotel is a bit dated, and the hilly parking lot is intimidating, but there are not many places in Branson that are not hill challenged. The age of the hotel didn't affect the coziness of my room. The breakfast is continental...for those of you who don't know what that entails, perhaps you should do some research. Continental is not sausage and eggs. And as for all the reviews I found saying how the hotel took more money than needed off credit/debit cards...this is a very typical practice of hotels. It's for incidentals. Pay cash if you don't want to worry about it. I would recommend this hotel, especially for families with small children. The indoor pool is amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Birthdayboy”
Reviews.Author: lostsole
Reviews.Content: Our stay was VERY nice, it started at the moment we walked in, the staff was very nice to us, the room was very clean, hot tub was hot which I loved. As for the hill, what doesn't sit on a hill in Branson, We enjoyed our stay and would have no problem staying there again. As for smell it smelled like any other motel room, it's not home, I always take a candle with me so any place smells like home, smells like home without the MOTHER-IN-LAW

Reviews.Title: “Great place for the price and family friendly”
Reviews.Author: DallasLuv2travel
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay here. The staff was friendly and accommodating. I traveled with small children and requested a room on a lower floor and was immediately moved to a lower level. My kids enjoyed the swimming in both the indoor and outdoor pools. The motel is not new, but is clean and a great price.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible!!!!!!!!!! Stay away!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Soonerfan47
Reviews.Content: We were going to stay Monday and Tuesday nights...The smell in the room was so bad we had to leave..They wouldnt budge on giving us our money back, we left anyway..Couldnt stand it!!

Reviews.Title: “This motel was horrible!”
Reviews.Author: scoobie1974
Reviews.Content: The breakfast was not good at all -- very slim variety. The rooms smelled like musty/moldy/mildew. We did see mold growing on the ceiling and what appeared to be mold growing on the wall below the sink. The jets in the whirlpool by the indoor was broken. The dryer was broken for the first half of our trip -- and we were never informed when it was fixed. The light in the shallow end of the indoor pool fell out -- there way of fixing it was just to put it back in with no screws. Several kids were taking it out and playing with it. They did not care about horseplaying in the pool that could have easily hurt other children -- the only thing that they were worried about was the rope in the pool -- they would yell at you to get off of it even if you were not stainding on it or stretching it. We were finding cigerette butts floating in the pool. The pool was suppose to open at 8:30 but most of the time did not open until after 9. The lady that works the evening shift was really rude. The free internet was a joke!! We took our laptop to the front office to have the manager get us logged into the internet and he said it was our computer --- funny of how someone walked in to check out and complained of the same thing!!! There are much better motels in Branson for the same price or just a little bit more! The limo is still in the parking lot for sale.

Reviews.Title: “you get what you pay for...”
Reviews.Author: kjfishman
Reviews.Content: You get what you pay for, we paid $50 a night through Expedia. We didn't pay much and didn't get much.

Reviews.Title: “Totally worth the stay”
Reviews.Author: IamMomto2
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at this hotel with 2 young children and was very pleased with the hotel’s cleanliness, room size and indoor pool. Due to the great price and location, I wasn't sure exactly what we were in store for when we arrived at the hotel. I was pleasantly surprised beginning with the initial contact of the hotel staff at check-in. Smiles and pleasant attitudes are certainly values you don't see at a lot of "public" places, but we received both. The indoor pool and hot tub area is adjacent to the office (they also have outdoor pool which hadn't opened yet due to the weather) and is surrounded by 10 or so rooms. We happened to be one of the lucky ones to get a poolside room. Although our children smiled and giggled at the thought of being steps away from the pool, we were a bit reluctant since the pool didn't close until 10:45pm. Now, I'm a very "light" sleeper, but seriously, I could not hear any of the noise/excitement from the pool area while trying to sleep. The room's walls and doors definitely did their job to keep the noise out. (ha!) The pool was heated and very clean. The hot tub worked great and felt so nice after a long day. The breakfast was basic, but good and filling ~things my children normally eat for breakfast like cereal, toast, donuts, milk and juice. The hotel sits on a pretty steep hill, so the parking was a bit crazy, but a great location with easy access to the Red, Blue and Yellow side routes. Overall, we were very pleased with this hotel and will definitely try to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value!!”
Reviews.Author: blues2411
Reviews.Content: This is an older hotel yet our room was very clean and well maintained. The indoor pool was very nice and was loved by the 5 year old traveling with us. The location was hard to beat. The hill was killer and I don't know how people in a stick could manage it. While this hotel is not as nice as say the Hilton it was a great value and we had a wonderful stay. It's not a 5 star hotel but it was clean and fairly inexpensive. I would stay here again in a heart beat!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic for the price!”
Reviews.Author: TeraBytes2
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the queen suite with the 2 person whirlpool tub in it. The room was nice and clean, just very old. The whirlpool tub was absolutely fantastic! We had no problems during check-in; the staff seemed very nice. We didn't go in the indoor pool, but our suite was right next to it (it looked clean though). Only thing bad I can say about that is when kids are in the pool, it really echoes and you can hear it in your room....but what do you expect, your door is only a few feet from the pool. I didn't find the steep hill to be a problem at all, but I can see where it may be slippery and dangerous in the winter. Overall I was very surprised at this hotel...this is the first time we've stay in a non brand name hotel. The original cost for the queen whirlpool tub room was $71 I think, which blew me away...other hotels with a whirlpool tub were over $100. Plus we got a coupon code online for $35 off our hotel cost from orbitz.com. Overall I would totally stay here again and recommend it to my friends. But if you are looking for a fancy, up to date hotel with nice plush towels, this one isn't for you. If you're looking for clean rooms with an awesome whirlpool tub for an inexpensive price, this is it!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing!!!”
Reviews.Author: VivianaMilwaukee
Reviews.Content: Our gloomy rooms had an unpleasant odor when we arrived. Our adjoing dreary rooms each had an unexpected annoying live bug to add to the lack of positive ambiance. When we had difficulties with one of the toilets, we called the front desk. The man told us that we could come down to the office to get a plunger! The parking lot is VERY slanted. There was a limosene parked in the lot with rocks behind the tires. Parking the car was a tilting experience, and walking across the sloping lot to the room was definately challenging. Our trip to Branson included an absolutely delightful array of shows(Shoji, Bill Medley/Paul Revere, Legends and Noah) and dining experiences(Landry's, Bob Evans, and Andy Williams Grille). We certainly recommend the Branson experience to all, but DEFINATELY NOT the Ozark Mountain Inn.

Reviews.Title: “This Inn is a major out!”
Reviews.Author: GrnEyes2020
Reviews.Content: We had attempted to find a hotel in a good location by looking online, but finally decided to just wait and book something when we arrived in Branson. After driving the strip, we thought despite the bright yellow color of the building, the hotel appeared to be in a somewhat good location for what we wanted to do and at a price that wouldn't leave us wondering how we would afford to do anything else. One of the worst things about this place is the parking lot. The entire lot is at a steep angle, I can't imagine how anyone could get in or out in snow or sleet. The people at the front desk were friendly and helpful. The rooms appeared somewhat clean, but the beds and pillows were hard as rocks. The bed had two flat sheets on it instead of a fitted and the blanket looked like something I would have let my dog sleep on. I looked for an outlet to plug my phone into in the room and the only outlet I could find was the one the bedside lamp was plugged into. An old brown extension cord ran to the other side of the bed for the other lamp. There was one plug in by the sink that the coffee maker (a really ancient yellow minature Mr. Coffee) and the hair dryer (desperately in need of cleaning from a clogged filter) shared. There was a bottle of complimentary shampoo on the sink which we dumped after noticing that the seal had been broken. The bath towels were about the size of two hand towels and extremely rough. The ceilings were stained and appeared ready to fall in at any moment in spots. Now here's the best part. When we checked in we were told there was wireless internet and furnished instructions on how to connect to it. I was able to connect to it for a brief time the first evening, but couldn't connect when I tried later that evening. I tried again the next morning hoping to check on some of the events we were interested in. No luck again! My husband called the front office and was told that they have a tough time connecting with internet at the hotel and that I should bring my laptop down by the pool for better reception. Are you serious??? I finally tried it later that day in desperation, and was able to see yet another connection option of the hotel's I hadn't even been able to see from our 2nd floor room. I was able to connect after a few tries but, once again lost the connection when I tried to look at a second site. By then I was so mad I shut my computer down and went back to the room. My husband decided to grab a cup of coffee and a bagel in the morning. The bagel tasted like it had been sitting out for a few days at the least. The best recommendation I have about this place is to stay someplace else. We will neve go back there!

Reviews.Title: “Ruined Our Whole Trip(Pay In Cash!!)”
Reviews.Author: prkchp1975
Reviews.Content: This hotel took 3 times the total amount of our stay off my check card without my authorization, which in turn locked my account up to where I could not make purchases using my checking account. When I tried to resolve the problem after checking out and returning home after our stay the manager treated me VERY, VERY rudely, not only did he yell at me though the phone, he repeatedly kept telling me that I should not be going places if I do not have enough money in my account to handle situations like this, even after I explained that I only put a specific amount in my account to pay for our trip just incase our card was stolen or lost, as if our financial state is any of his concern. We left no damages and if anything our room was left very clean, the front desk attendants seemed to be nice and helpful except for this one manager. We sincerely hope you do not experience the trip we had and are still trying to resolve. We still do not have our money back, so be careful!!!! Last time I checked it is illegal to remove money from an account with out authorization.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Wonderful Place to stay!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great! The people were friendly, the rooms were clean, they helped us find everywhere we needed to go!!! Everyone was just great! Would definitely stay there again. The only thing that should be upgraded is the continental breakfast... We were on a budget, but still couldn't just eat what they offered. All in all, we would stay there again definitely!!!

HotelInfo.Name: Ozark Mountain Inn
HotelInfo.Address: 1415 West Highway 76, PO Box 2323, Branson, MO 65616 (Formerly Travelodge)
